Build 3.0rc2

On the following stack trace (from bug 67440), if trace is printed to console

located at all (dialog opens saying it was unable to perform). e.g.    at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.JavaOutlineInformationControl.getSuperTypeHier
archy(JavaOutlineInformationControl.java:794)
 
Setup:
- self-hosting workspace, with JDT Core from CVS, and all others as imported 
binary plugins (attached sources).

It's a source lookup path issue. The source lookup path is based on the 
project/config that you use to launch PrettyTrace. If you add more projects to 
the source lookup path, you will have more success.

I looked at the code, and required plug-ins don't show up when you ask to add 
a java project with its required projects. This is beacuse we consider 
required projects as classpath entries of kind CPE_PROJECT. We do not resolve 
containers to determine if there are projects in them.

The workaround is to add the source jars manually, which is a pain.

(Note: the code that addds required projects for source lookup is the same 
since 2.1).
Do not intend to fix for 3.0
Now works in the java stack trace console.
